intro: Thryptomene wannooensis, commonly known as the Wannooensis thryptomene, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Thryptomene wannooensis is often found in heathlands and is valued for its ecological role in supporting native wildlife.
